title: What I expect as expected value is different than the actual expected value in TreeExplainer

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behaviour

body:
I thought that the `expected_value` was calculated by averaging the predictions, but I'm not being able to do it manually.
Fully reproducible example below using latest `master`.

```
import numpy as np
import xgboost
import shap

X,y = shap.datasets.adult()
model = xgboost.XGBClassifier(n_estimators=100, max_depth=2).fit(X, y)

explainer = shap.TreeExplainer(model, X[:1000], feature_perturbation='interventional', model_output='probability')                                   
                                     
shap_values = explainer(X[:1000])

what_I_expect_as_base_value_from_labels = model.predict(X[:1000]).astype(int).mean(0)
what_I_expect_as_base_value_from_probs = model.predict_proba(X[:1000])[:,1].mean(0)
print(f'What I expect as base value (from labels): {what_I_expect_as_base_value_from_labels:.3f}')
print(f'What I expect as base value (from probabilities): {what_I_expect_as_base_value_from_probs:.3f}')
print(f'Actual base value: {explainer.expected_value:.3f}')
```
Output:
```
What I expect as base value (from labels): 0.186
What I expect as base value (from probabilities): 0.234
Actual base value: 0.214
```

xgboost: 1.1.1

Why this difference?
